data.title: Enjoyable (pity debate number 2 blaring on most screens)
data.text:
The Brazilian pork stew was delicious. The pasta al Forno
was delightfully tasty. Interesting reviews previously about cleanliness issues 
But yet here they are serving perfectly palatable food on clean plates and no sign of surliness from the purportedly rude staff. Give them another go

data.title: Awesome Atmosphere, Great Local Brewery!
data.text: What a cool place to hang out, watch a sports game, grub some pizza and have a few cold brews! We sampled 5 of their beers, and liked all of them.  Amber Ale was our choice for the afternoon.  The dining/bar area is really unique with bar seating, family style table tops, a large room equipped with tables and toys for kids, and an area of floor seating with eclectic pillows.  Microbrewery is onsite and visible from most tables in the restaurant.  The dining areas are decorated with Brazilian artifacts and photographs. It was a tough decision, but finally decided on the Orgasmica Pizza and really liked it.  The names of the pizzas in the menu are "orgasmic", including the "Kindy Cow", "Kama Sutra" and "Doggie Style". A little pricey I have to admit, but worth the atmosphere.  TV's are everywhere and all tuned in to different sports games.  What a cool place to chill!  Free parking is available behind the restaurant.

data.title: Average at best
data.text: The pizza was not the greatest, the beer = same, I would personally avoid and check out something more similar to Bar Bocce in Sausalito or Patxi's.

data.title: Good microbrews and pizza
data.text: They have a great selection of beer and you can get unlimited 4 ounce glasses for just $1.25 each.  How cool is that?  They were out of the porter when we visited so that was a downer.  The pizza was not orgasmic, but pretty damn good.  The crust was tasty and the toppings were high quality.  The service was solid and there's ample free parking behind the restaurant.  There are lots of TVs and the bar area is very open so it would be a great place to watch a game.  The prices were a tad high but not unreasonable considering you're in downtown San Rafael.

data.title: Tasteless Pizza, What's The Hype All About?
data.text: We have tried this establishment three times, and they have struck out completely.  Wanted to give it a go as so many people like it.  Maybe for the beer? Not the pizza, as far as we are concerned.   We just do not understand the enthusiasm people have for this place, and will return no more. Stick with Lococo's in Terra Linda for a true dynamic pizza experience!

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: My partner David and I ate here Monday 13th June our last evening in the USA it was quite late and they were closing in an hour however we were warmly welcomed...we chose the Orgasmica pizza ...it was the most tasty pizza we have ever tasted! The wine was also very palatable. Kudos to everyone at Pizza Orgasmica especially our sweet waiter and the hard working kitchen staff. We will be back if and when we are back in San Fran.

data.title: Good Pizza - Indifferent attitude by staff towards their customers
data.text: Pizza was good.  Place was fairly nice.  Very few people in for lunch on a Monday so I expected better service. While we waited at their stand to be seated, two employees there very slowly sauntered by without even acknowledging us.  They just left.  Not a lot of friendliness from the waitress either.  Strange....bathrooms were gross.  Muddy floors, rusted sink rains, outdated, smelly.  Probably won't be back as there are other numerous places to dine at in San Rafael.

data.title: Judging by the crowd, it must be good
data.text: This is a happening place in the centre of San Rafael. We stopped for a take-out pizza on our way to Samuel Taylor State Park campground and had to wait quite a while for our turn. When it came, we were't disappointed.

data.title: Slow slow slow and bad pizza
data.text: I've eaten in and gotten delivery from here many times.  The pizza available in San Rafael is mostly garbage, so this second to third rate pizza is actually one of the better options, unfortunately.  The pizza is routinely soggy, doughy, undercooked.  If getting delivery, order about two hours before you expect to be hungry because when they say it'll take an hour, expect an hour and a half at best. I'm writing this on a random Wednesday after "about an hour@ took over two hours. Oh, and their beer is pretty mediocre.

data.title: Great Place for Dinner with the Little Ones
data.text: Went there for dinner with my family (three toddler grandkids).  The pizza was good, if you like think crust (which I do).  But the best part was the room in the back with a lot of toys for the younger kids to play with.  You can sit at the table and watch them play.  Keeps them occupied while you enjoy your dinner.

data.title: Pizza Orgasmica, Really good pizza!
data.text: Great pizza place in San Rafael and SF - great Brazilian food and the best selection of pizzas you can find - very nice ambient and people. Must try it!

data.title: Service
data.text: I really want to like this place, and I have gone there several times. But the service is lousy. I have been in there when there are 19 people working and 15 people in the restaurant, and still couldn't get the attention of anyone to bring me a beer. By the way, the beer is made on premises and is very good. And, it seems the service is getting better frrom what it's been - I guess it was a common complaint?

data.title: Yea not the bother
data.text: We went here cause my boyfriend loves beer. I don't like pizza or pasta so I guess not a good place for me to go, but it's suppose to be a pizza and Brazilian brewery so I expected more food choices. It's just pizza and pasta!! And there is not even gourmet pizza aka no marinara sauce pizza....Then I don't believe you should call yourself a pizza and Brazilian restaurant!!!  I couldn't even find an appetizer. And my boyfriend said the beer wasn't good. They should just call this place a bar and not deceive us with fancy names like Brazilian, orgasmic pizza and brew beer?

data.title: Fun and delicious!
data.text: Lots of great pizza choices and delicious gluten free! Nice atmosphere too, I like that they play the grateful dead, apparently exclusively! It's a very San Francisco themed place. Beer and wine only but it's their own beer and it's great!!!

data.title: Pricey pizza pies
data.text: Pizza was OK but not worth the price paid.  Service was slow and placed our group at a tiny bar table that was unable to accommodate our Large pizza, our drinks, and room for our plates.  We placed it on the table next to us because there were only two other dining groups in the place. she sat our party at the small bar table because she deemed the regular dining area closed for the night 40 minutes before closing time even though there was another party eating in the area.  I guess she already swept the floor and didn't want us customers to soil it.

data.title: We'll Be Back!
data.text: This was our first experience at Pizza Orgasmica.  We had been at this restaurant in 2001 but it was called something else and the menu quite different.  The ambiance and location in San Rafael is terrific with good 'people watching'.  We sat on high stools near the big sliding door where we had a 360 view of the inside and out, all the pictures on the walls, the sports screens, galley, bar...everything.  Hubby had their own Pale Ale, I had the 4 grain Hefeweizen and both were quite good/refreshing.  I had a personal size Kamasutra and he had the personal size Orgasmica both on the corn crust and they were both perfect, excellent, very tasty and fabulous textures.   We saw another couple served a sizzling steak dish that looked and smelled WONderful and generally speaking, the plates coming out from the galley looked equally tantalizing.  We were there at about 1:30 p.m. on Sunday, the weather was perfect so having the open doors was fun and relaxing with a vacation type feel to it.  Soon after we arrived about 30 more patrons (one a small team of children and adults) so it got busy, real fast.   The prices are fair and the service was good and with lots of smiles.  No, it's not organic, but it IS orgasmic :-)

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: Ate there three times during the week my husband and I stayed in San Rafael and enjoyed our meal every time. It's a bit noisy, and there are lots of TV screens around but the pizza is the best I've had, so we kept going back.

data.title: Spacious, inviting, amazing salads, great for kids' parties!
data.text:
The San Rafael location was a wonderful place for a child's birthday party, with a separate upstairs room holding several kid-size tables, a play area full of toys, a large bar for staging food and beverages and a long event table.  There is a rest room on the same level so you can take the little ones easily without having to go downstairs into the main dining room and there's a separate back entrance to the "play area" dining room right off the parking lot.  All the servers at our event were excellent and attentive.
The salads were huge, beautifully presented, varied and delicious, served with plenty of different dressings as well.  We couldn't finish all the salads so the staff packed them nicely to take home.
This was one of the most interesting restaurants I've ever been to and I'm looking forward to returning for an adult gathering to enjoy some of the house brews and Brazilian appetizers.

data.title: Best lunch pizza and brew in the city!
data.text:
This is my Go-To eatery for pizza (2 toppings), salad (house or Caesars), and any brew on tap for $10.00.
The combination of the three food items (yes, beer is food) was XLNT!
The Porter was one of my top 3 favorite in house Porter.
Ooooo, they serve authentic Brazilian foods here too! 
Moms and dads, for your kids: 1 topping pizza, salad and soda for under $6.00; and a really cool play area for families!
Yes, they do have a happy hour, and yes, I will return later and report on their happy hour...

data.title: Great pizza...but can you get a few more staff?
data.text: We love, love, love the pizza and the beer is excellent. It is great they will let you taste the beer. But...we can never seem to get a beer right away. Takes a while to be seated even when not full so now we know to go to the bar. Even at the bar last week it took 15 min to get a beer. Took a long time to order. Once the pizza came it took a few minutes to get silverware. Please...we want to come back but when you have a babysitter at home or want to catch a movie we can't take a chance on coming in.
